title: Famous Paintings
description: Can you identify these famous paintings and their artists?

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci between 1503 and 1519. It hangs in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

questions.question: Which artist painted 'Starry Night'?
questions.explanation: Vincent van Gogh painted 'The Starry Night' in June 1889 while staying at the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum in Saint-Remy-de-Provence, France.

questions.question: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel?
questions.explanation: Michelangelo painted the Sistine Chapel ceiling between 1508 and 1512. The most famous section is 'The Creation of Adam.'

questions.question: Which painting features a woman with a pearl earring, painted by Johannes Vermeer?
questions.explanation: 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' was painted by Johannes Vermeer around 1665. It is sometimes called the 'Mona Lisa of the North.'

questions.question: Who painted 'The Last Supper'?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted 'The Last Supper' between 1495 and 1498 on the wall of the dining hall at Santa Maria delle Grazie in Milan.

questions.question: Which artist is known for painting 'Water Lilies,' a series of approximately 250 oil paintings?
questions.explanation: Claude Monet painted his famous Water Lilies series over the last 30 years of his life, inspired by his flower garden at Giverny.

questions.question: Who painted 'The Persistence of Memory,' featuring melting clocks?
questions.explanation: Salvador Dali painted 'The Persistence of Memory' in 1931. It is one of the most recognizable works of Surrealism.

questions.question: Which painting by Edvard Munch depicts a figure with an agonized expression against a turbulent sky?
questions.explanation: 'The Scream' was painted by Edvard Munch in 1893. It has become one of the most iconic images of art, symbolizing modern human anxiety.

questions.question: Who painted 'American Gothic,' showing a farmer and his daughter before a house with a Gothic window?
questions.explanation: Grant Wood painted 'American Gothic' in 1930. The models were his sister and his dentist. It is one of the most familiar images in American art.

questions.question: Which artist painted 'Guernica,' depicting the horrors of the Spanish Civil War?
questions.explanation: Pablo Picasso painted 'Guernica' in 1937 in response to the bombing of the Basque town of Guernica during the Spanish Civil War.

questions.question: Who painted 'The Birth of Venus,' depicting the goddess emerging from the sea?
questions.explanation: Sandro Botticelli painted 'The Birth of Venus' around 1485. It is housed in the Uffizi Gallery in Florence, Italy.

questions.question: Which painting by Georges Seurat pioneered the Pointillist technique?
options: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
questions.explanation: 'A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte' (1884-1886) by Seurat is the most famous example of Pointillism, using tiny dots of color.

questions.question: Who painted 'Nighthawks,' showing people in a late-night diner?
questions.explanation: Edward Hopper painted 'Nighthawks' in 1942. It depicts customers in a downtown diner late at night and is considered his most famous work.

questions.question: Which Dutch master painted 'The Night Watch' in 1642?
questions.explanation: Rembrandt van Rijn painted 'The Night Watch' in 1642. It is one of the most famous Dutch Golden Age paintings and hangs in the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam.

questions.question: Who painted 'Christina's World,' showing a woman crawling through a field toward a farmhouse?
questions.explanation: Andrew Wyeth painted 'Christina's World' in 1948. The woman depicted is Christina Olson, who had a degenerative muscular condition.
